title: Problems of the Italian school system 2019
summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market and lowest at Response Others.
The maximum Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market has got 13.0 times higher Share of respondents than the minimum Response Others.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The Share of respondents is highest at Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market and lowest at Response Others.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market and lowest at Response Others.
The maximum Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market has got 13.0 times higher Share of respondents than the minimum Response Others.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Share of respondents for 9 number of Responses.
The Share of respondents is highest at Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market and lowest at Response Others.
The second highest Share of respondents is appeared to be the Response Lack of funding and resources.
The highest Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market has 24.0 more Share of respondents than the lowest Response Others.

The Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market has the highest Share of respondents, followed by Lack of funding and resources, and Lack of financial aid for low-income families and students. Down to the Response Others which is the lowest.
Response Bad teachers, and Lack of financial aid for low-income families and students have a similar Share of respondents that is 13.0.
Considered together, the average Share of respondents in all 9 Responses is roughly 11.11.

data.Response: Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market
Lack of financial aid for low-income families and students
